main event: The observer witnessed a meteor-like object in the western sky that formed a 180-degree arc and was visible for less than a second.
interesting points: The object was much wider than a typical meteor and had a speckled, stardust-like appearance with little to no space between the speckles.
The object did not resemble any meteors or shooting stars the witness had seen before.
A plane was passing over the area, and an unusual bright light came on the plane, then went out after a short interval. The witness believed this light was an unusual feature of the aircraft.
The witness heard about similar sightings in the Princeton, Illinois area from discussions with local teachers and a retired insurance salesman.
The witness was initially reluctant to report the sighting due to fear of ridicule, but decided to come forward after hearing about the similar sightings in the area.
sighted object: a meteor-like object that formed a 180-degree arc
